content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												Imagine the perfect robbery: you know the blueprints inside out, when the guards go for their coffee breaks, and exactly how to get into the safe. Everything goes without a hitch, and by the time the safe is found, you're laughing. Not a shot fired. Payday: The Heist doesn't work like that.Despite the crime-caper presentation, tactical objectives and elaborate plans, Payday always comes down to shooting. Four players go into a situation - a bank with a vault full of juicy gold in the basement, an ambush to rescue a prisoner from a police convoy - and then get into a hell of a big fight with the police. It's a magpie co-op shooter, most obviously influenced by Left 4 Dead's dynamic approach to the team-based FPS and Modern Warfare's Spec Ops mode, and its developers are clearly students of the mass of 'horde' modes out there.Payday has faults, but is very good indeed, an FPS where common elements are carefully made to fit its rhythm rather than just taken for granted: this sounds like faint praise, but it has the best ammo balancing I've seen in a long time. Players start fully-stocked and a perk can give bigger starting clips, but from that point every bullet has to be maximised. Enemies drop small amounts of ammo, but only enough to keep your head above water.Health is equally well-handled, a mixture of an overall bar that only recharges in segments and a 'shield' that recharges wholly. The more the overall bar goes down, the faster the player is knocked down, making it a treasure to be guarded: a backup that in clutch moments gives that extra second of life.You're always on a knife-edge. A healthy team can feel invincible, but a team that's been banged up is too brittle to fight carelessly. One-time deployables can be taken into missions, and using them wisely is a whole other story.On top of such considered engineering, Payday boasts a winning art style that mixes grotesque clown masks with sharp suits and a brutishly high-tech take on law enforcement. Even more impressive - stunning, even - is the dynamic audio design, which contributes to all of Payday's most exhilarating moments. One level will have a tight, looping drum beat that builds and builds into a pounding house tune just as all hell is breaking loose; another will begin with a cheesy piece of europop that turns into an industrial wail of sirens. It has an absolute gift for catching the right moment to push itself to the front and centre of the experience, and burrows its way into your mindset. When the sound's going crazy, so are you.The cops are a motley bunch at the start of a mission, wearing their short-sleeved blue shirts and little caps and dying in droves. As things pick up, more capable classes start mixing into the waves: machine-gunners with light body armour, shotgunners in thick riot gear and special agents that sneak around before emptying a revolver into your back. Individually, they don't amount to much and neither does the AI, but you'll only ever see them in swarming groups that seem to come from nowhere, relentlessly battering a fixed position or skewering a moving group.Payday's mission structure is basically 'quiet time' and then 'assault', with much more of the latter. Each of its setups has mission objectives to be completed in the middle of the shooting, but every single one involves holding down a button at a certain point then waiting for a timer to tick down. Heat it ain't, but things are kept interesting by the objectives changing position and sequence on each playthrough - a structure that comes to fruition in Diamond Heist. (More on that later.)There are always small groups of cops around, but every few minutes the game sends a heavily-telegraphed wave of enemies in, which puts the game in 'Assault' mode. These relentless firefights can last from a few minutes to what feels like an eternity, but is probably more like 15 minutes - and during it, hundreds and hundreds of cops will die. They pour out of corridors, scale balconies, drop from helicopters, bust down doors, explode out of lift shafts - and if they get position on your team, the crossfire is withering.The final twist in every assault wave is the special cops. They're half Left 4 Dead's special infected, half Modern Warfare 2's riot shields and Juggernauts - but at least they're good copies. The taser cop immobilises players with unerring accuracy, making them spasm and empty their gun's clip wildly until a team-mate intervenes or they go down. The Bulldozer's a giant that can take sustained punishment and mete it out, a terrifying sight when you're in a corner, and shield-toting cops make a slower but no less inexorable advance on your position, begging you to waste bullets. Cloakers are the one original nasty: pinpoint spec-ops soldiers that specialise in sneaking up or rushing in for a deadly melee attack and then picking off your buddies when they wander in to save the day.The police have a lot of options and there's no telling exactly what an assault wave will contain - some wars are won at a distance with calm precision and some with a shotgun in the face. Payday only offers six missions, and some of those aren't huge, but the ebb and flow of its assault waves means it just about gets away with it - even in the same environment, with the same starting positions, no two waves play out alike.Payday does have one recurring problem: its downtime is often too long. There will be times when, one minute after surviving a pitched battle, you're waiting on a roof for the next event to be triggered or the next police attack - and nothing happens. Payday's best moments are when it stitches its discrete chunks together seamlessly, moving from dynamic objectives into assault waves into brief respites. But every so often, it just leaves you hanging.There are other flat notes. Civilians can be tied up to use as hostages - these can be traded between rounds for any team member who's gone down permanently, and cause the police to start sending in rescue squads. The mechanic fills a role capably enough but feels a little under-developed: being able to use hostages as bargaining chips or human shields during assaults, for example, would seem obvious.Payday doesn't even go that deep, and to be fair it shows little desire to. But there are infuriating inconsistencies within its world. You must avoid killing civilians, for example, in the midst of these slaughterfests - but these civilians are so nakedly designed to keep on running into crossfire that hitting one feels like the game's pulled a trick on you.There are plenty more moments of silliness, but Payday gets it right, too: sawing through bars and burning through vault roofs with thermite are the stuff blueprints are made of. And then there's the Diamond Heist.In terms of robber fantasies, there are few better setups than a high-security vault filled with diamonds on the top floor of a skyscraper, slap bang in the middle of a party. Only available on Hard difficulty, Diamond Heist is easily Payday's most dynamic and varied mission, with major branches opening up differently on each play-through, and it's set in a quite brilliant environment.The vault's in the middle, and several balcony floors rise around it full of offices and cubbyholes. Staircases lead to a huge roof with a helipad and glass skylights. The mission can be completed entirely through stealth, the four players moving silently from floor to floor disabling alarms and avoiding security patrols, before a clean getaway without a shot fired. This didn't happen a single time that I was involved. Rating: 10/10

It's not a game for 'John Rambo' players.It's very hard to obtain all achiviements, because the game is a lot hard, even on normal difficulty, especially without a good teamwork.The game has inspirations on Left 4 Dead. The crew of Overkill admitted that, and put a lot of easter eggs of Left 4 Dead on game. Also, you can find easter eggs from the movie Heat (1995) that has a history of a bank robbery.Explore the game while trying to survive...Team up and got fun!  My Personal Score   Fun: 8/10   Gameplay: 8/10   Ambientation: 7/10   History: 3/10   Replayability: 8/10   Multiplayer: 9/10 --Payday The Heist - Análise: Se divirta com os caras mausEste é um jogo excitante, onde você não apenas pode trabalhar em equipe, mas realmente precisa fazê-lo.É um jogo para jogar com amigos, como um time. Não é um jogo para jogadores do tipo 'John Rambo'.É muito dificil obter todas as conquistas, porque o jogo é muito dificil, mesmo na dificuldade normal, especialmente sem um bom trabalho em equipe.O jogo possui inspirações em Left 4 Dead. A equipe da Overkill admitiu isso e colocou vários easter eggs do jogo. Você também vai encontrar easter eggs do filme Heat (Fogo contra Fogo - 1995), que conta a história de um assalto a banco.Explore o jogo enquanto tenta sobreviver...Junte seu time e se divirta! content:
Posted: June 25, 2016
 So, you wanna rob some banks?  ..... well this is not exactly the case here. If you want a more active, more content (and DLC) filled and more varied game, I suggest you get PAYDAY 2. The issuses surrounding micro-transactions have been dealt with, they have been removed, and community is back to normal. That being said, what do you get from this game  BASIC FEATURES:   Heists (or missions) in which you have to complete certain objectives such as defending a position, or keeping the hostages in check while your team mates gather cash. While there is only one proper "bank heist", other missions have a good variety, ranging from heist in a Hospital to escorting a VIP Heist (or missions) can be done solo or with friends/strangers(Recommended) Each heist gives you cash at the end, which is like experience progression system found in RPGs. You earn this by playing well, like headshots etc, helping teammates, and simply completing your objectives. There are three skill trees (fourth being DLC) that you can spend you cash in. Assault, Sharpshooter and Support (Technician in DLC); each with their own unique upgrades.  You select the tree, and you level in that skill as you play. REMARKS * It's pretty well optimized. * Graphics are good enough for a multiplayer game.* Overall gameplay is quite good, with pretty satisfying gunplay. Guns sound really amazing as well.* Music is stellar, with tracks ranging from tense to exhilarating and adds to the experience.* Since there are only a handful of missions, playing them again and again could feel repetitive. Though they have enough variety in their objectives that they don't feel stale, at least for a while. Also, if you play this game in breaks (like playing during weekends only), you wouldn't get bothered by it.  * Unlocking upgrades is a bit tedious, as you need to do quite many missions to get you hands on the good stuff.* Due to the popularity of it's big brother PAYDAY 2, it's sometimes are to find a match, Though, you should not have any problems during the peaks hours. CONCLUSION/HOW MUCH RECOMMENDATION? Overkill (the studio behind it) clearly put much love and effort into the game. But it only seems like a prototype for the much bigger and better PAYDAY 2, which team's passion passion shine. Regardless, this is a fun competent and extremely enjoyable Co-op FPS. If you've not played any online FPS/ played a few online FPS  : While I can point to Team Fortress 2 and Left 4 Dead 2, but if you are interested in a more "realistic" game, then I RECOMMENDED it. This is one of the few FPSs which I think neither too complex that it becomes overwhelming, it is not too simple either that it becomes boring. Also, it works quite well on low end PCs and Laptops. But, I also suggest you give PAYDAY 2 (GOTY edition) a shot, if you have a good PC, and extra money for DLCs If you've played a quite many online FPS  : If you like FPSs that are simple and fun divergence, where you don't need to learn the mechanics and intricacies of the systems, you can give it a go. Otherwise, simply go with PAYDAY 2 (GOTY edition).

content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												Payday is an amazingly fun game. I like how simple, independent games like these always manage to get me to sink many more hours into it than any of the higher budget titles that are out. Unlike most shooters out, Payday forces you to play realistically. Your goal is not to rack up a body count, but to perform a heist. Rough around the edges, short in length, and aiming takes some time to get use to. However, in it's own way, it is very innovative. Each stage (lasting roughly 25-35 minutes) boasts with new surprises and situations depending on how you play and who you play with. No run through of any stage is ever the same. The stylish gameplay, cool concepts, and massive amounts of variety within it's few stages will keep players coming back for a very long time.

content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
												So, this is a COOP game from 2011, but since half of these reviews are slow as ♥♥♥♥, I decided to come back and reveal yet another game from the dephts of the past years. I present to you, PAYDAY: The Heist.This game is♥♥♥♥♥♥ass fun with friends, and not that good when playing solo. PAYDAY: The Heist's synopsis involves 4 professional guys robbing picked out heists. When I first started this game, I was given the benefit of the doubt in thinking that this will be some crappy indie game, even more doubt when I found out the company, Overkill Software, was formed from the directors of GRIN, whom is responsible for one of the worst, most generic games ever made, EVER. I was wrong.GRAPHICSNow, the game doesn't have those top-notch graphics we see, it ponders more to the gameplay, but this section isn't left out. Everything, from the First World Bank, to the No Mercy hospital is enriched in detail, and complexity. Low-res textures are, as much as they can, removed and only when you are some detail-nut who likes to notice things. The game doesn't offer that much of a linear chance, but everything is complex and well-made. There are also some visual filter stuff in the menu I don't use. Bloom♥♥♥♥♥♥ while appearing at some points of a heist, is not excessive and appears only for added realism. All-in all, graphics are pretty good.SOUNDThe sounds, while not perfectly executed, give some needed environments the buff they need. Civilians screaming in terror are probably the most thought out, but the guns don't sound great. For example, the cops shooting their pistol sounds pretty ♥♥♥♥ing weak. And when huge firefights occur, the gun sounds just take a huge♥♥♥♥♥♥and leave, because everything is just said gun sounds, no bullets whizzings or anything. Doesn't give that much of a scenery if you ask me. The music makes up for it though. It's a mix of rock and electronic, and gives you that adrenaline pump when you need it. Bass rapes the songs at times, but it's still executed to pump you even more.GAMEPLAYNow here is the best part of the game. It really gives it it's substance. You and your buddies go on heists that are picked for you. Prediction is eliminated at this point, because every situation occurs RANDOMLY, and requires you and your team to pick out your loadouts carefully. At the start, you are bestowned with the option to scout out ahead and mark out the plan, which doesn't give the game that immediate action build like the mainstream concurence now-a-days. The only drawback I have on this heisting system is how unreal it is. Seriously, you get like 5000 SWAT officers shoved up your♥♥♥♥♥ WHERE the ♥♥♥♥ do they find this kind of firepower? I am drilling the vault, and a great bunch of police officers appear at an Assault wave ready to buttrape you. Of course, this is all for an intended challenge, but really? You're gonna bring the whole America down on my♥♥♥♥♥ Once you start the heist, you can use the F key to shout at stupid♥♥♥♥♥civilians who don't listen to you. They also managed to sucessfully find some use out of the keyboard key. You can use that to make officers cuff themselves, mark out special units, and do a ♥♥♥♥♥on of other things. It's amazing how much use one button can do here. Most of the gameplay involves drills and saws that are required, so it may get tedious for you, but the replayability and different scenarios excuse for it it, and gives it more interest the more you play. The A.I, unfortunatley, sucks balls when you play solo, but it can be perfectly understood because this is a CO-OP game and not designed only for you (if in that case you have no friends, ♥♥♥♥♥♥). The game also warrants defending your backs. If you go alone to find some object or♥♥♥♥♥♥ you can guarantee you'll be in custody, unless you're pretty sure you can handle the cops. It's all about thinking and planning everything out as a team. You get a HUGE arsenal for things to prep yourself up too. Silenced UZIs, pistols, 2 shotguns, assault rifles and so much more. If you're a gun-nut, you'll love it. I had some added problems with the difficulties, because it's just police spam all around, and basically redefines the whole meaning of difficult. You need to SERIOUSLY prep up and have some firepower to finish a mission on the highest difficulty. This difficulty is somewhat lowered when the music from earlier kicks in during an Assault wave for adrenaline, and also the added cash, to remind your ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥that you have a million bucks waiting for you to roll in.STORYThere is no story for the game, but it has a synopsis. Basically, 4 guys (a♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ a Sheffield guy, American and a Swedish) gather around and eventually meet some hacker/whatever called Bain. From then on, it's straight heisting. My favourite guy is Hoxton, the British♥♥♥♥♥♥This game is what CO-OP should be. While it has some drawbacks, I had kickass time playing it, so I give it an:8.5/10"

Posted: February 7, 2015
												-Amazing plot: rob banks and run around like headless chickens screaming out for Bain.-Real 3D-time technology: drills/saws are so realistic that you find yourself staring at them during the entire heist!-Very motivating rewards: loot cash from banks to spend it on absolutely nothing! Thank you, Overkill.-Infinite playability: ever get bored? Smuggle out the same Chinese prisoner over a hundred times!-Endless action: there's more cops than there are dollar bills in the bank you're trying to rob!-Superb graphics: did I ever mention something about the drills/saws looking like a real piece of art?-Massive supply of guns: really, there must be almost a dozen guns in this game!1!11111!11-Incredibly balanced: as a team of four, absorb over a thousand bullets and take down over thousands of cops! Alone!-Intelligent AI: feel free to solo, having your AI team stare at a wall while you're bleeding out.-Great community: teammates tend to try to shoot a vase while you're trying to sneak your way into the pentagon.-Great community: did I mention the one time my team took the last bit of an ammo bag while I had litterally 0 ammunition left?-Great community: this one guy tried to kamikaze a bulldozer (juggernaut) by slapping it with his wrist.-This community is REALLY great: I love having my game paused for 5 minutes to have someone join then say "oopss, sry wrng room"-Detailed heists: I had to smuggle a chinese prisoner, tie him up into a chair, lift him up via balloon to have an airplane swoop by and catch it at the exact specific time-frame.-Great community: someone called me a d*** for not reviving him when he has a swarm of cops circled around him.-Bain is god: you don't know where he is, who is his, what he is but you still accept instructions on robbing the national bank from him.After falling off a roof I instantly recovered by grabbing my teammate's hand.420/69 would drill again.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
												Decided to come back to this from Payday 2, and this game does not ♥♥♥♥ing dissapoint.  Whereas Payday 2 has more options and an RPG style progression, Payday: The Heist is much more linear in how the game unfolds.  You can unlock all of the skills in the game, there are a small selection of weapons, and at most the "skills" are designed to work around a party of 4.What this game lacks in choice, it makes up for one of the best heist/action movie simulators you're going to play in a long damn time.  Straight up recreations of scenes from movies, or entire movies themselves.  Rather than throw 20+ different options to complete at a heist at you, you often have one objective to complete at a time, often with dozens of cops throwing themselves at you.Holed up on a rooftop with SWAT climbing up the sides and jumping from adjacent buildings at you? Check.  Fighting your way down a crowd downtown street, chasing a traitor who stole your cash ala HEAT? Check.  Sneaking into a highrise building to steal a buttload of diamonds while holding various corporate members hostage for negotiation?  Check and check.The graphics have aged a bit, being a 5 year old game, but they get the job done and it's well optimized.  The music is absolutely amazing, and in many aspects I would count it as better than Payday 2's soundtrack.  Rather than dubstep/DnB tracks, P:TH opts for breakbeat loops with emphasis on bass, giving it a lower key but higher overall intensity feeling to the shootouts.  Rather than spending the entire match in a constant shootout with cops regardless if there's an assault in progress or not, the game gives you downtime inbetween assaults, letting the tension build before dropping you into a balls out assault wave from every direction.  It gets you in the mood and honestly keeps me coming back to the game again and again.  I particularly enjoy the Panic Room Theme, which slowly builds up as you fight your way up the derelict apartment building to the saferoom filled with cash.At $15 this game is a steal, the WolfPack DLC is unnecessary but does come with some nice skills and weapons, it's your call though since it's 66% the price of the actual vanilla game.

												You will embark on a spectacular crime spree of six heart stopping heists, including blasting their way through a downtown bank vault robbery or managing hostages in an armored car hijacking. Teamwork is essential to ensure crew members provide cover under fire, guard key access points, break through various security measures and keep civilians in check. Survive wave after wave of the best that law enforcement can deploy as they shift strategies in response to your actions and style of playing.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												PROs:-Guns feel solid. While the starting stuff can feel a tiny bit weak at first, after getting some upgrades the weapons start to fill out nicely. -Difficult. Its kind of arguable, I suppose, that being difficult is a good thing, but its hard to feel like a winner without having to first travel down the bloodiest, most bullet-filled hell that the higher difficulties on this game can be. -Graphics aren't too bad; that's always a plus. Don't expect anything mind numbing on this front however. -Soundtrack is noice. There can never be enough beep-boops in my game music.-Teamwork is key. Also pretty arugable to be a pro, but there is nothing better in my opinion then completely curbstomping a giant wave of enemies with all of your friends (given that you are good enough). CONs:-The difficulty might push away people who just want a casual experience. Its pretty hard to be casual when its so easy to get downed. Break from cover without thinking on the higher difficulties? Dead. Not taking out Snipers? They will find a way to shoot you eventually. Bulldozer charging you from behind? Good luck with that. -PhysX installer bothers you as you boot up the game. This is fixable, however; just follow this guide:

content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												It's a bit weird considering that I came to know the franchise I played the most by 2016, by pirating it's very first game.Payday: The Heist.And when I paid my due (buying the original), it's because this game is just pure awesome!I'm still not of the hook yet, as when Payday 2 came along, I pirated it first until like 10-20 update the game have released, that's when I decide to just buy the original for good to make the enjoyment of the game unhindered by searching the pirated update (it still exist though, iirc)PDTH shines in it's cinematic heist flow and solid gun play, compared to Payday 2 which offer diverse playstyle and ever increasing arsenal and heist location. But Payday The Heist still holds its own as a classic throwback on the game that spark the genre of heisting-with-your-friend.One feature I would surely miss from the recent iteration is the character interaction during heisting. Every heist have some kind of story between the character as it progresses. I hope Payday 2 can aim higher on that department.Sadly, PDTH is bogged down on a number of element.The Heist is more-or-less static, you can only do it one way or a mix of 2 with still the major way basically the same with every heist released in PDTH.Progression system to unlock arsenal, equipment and passive skill is grindy at best. You won't reach the end growth if not clocking more than 50 hour doing the hardest heist getting all objective and loot. So it might turn off some people.There's only 1 game mode, which is heisting. Don't compare it to Left 4 Dead series which have mutator, scavenge, etc. But PDTH relief this by having the heist objective a new and different on each heist. Basically making the heist's objective on the same level with L4D various game mode if I say so.For those of you who came to know Payday 2 first, you won't regret buying this game that spark the genre. It might server as a break from your 1000th hour of Payday 2. It'll feel fresh, trust me.Even better if you can get your other heisting partner in Payday 2 to play along in this.Discount is really generous when it comes to sale.Getting DLC for this is more lucrative, since it ties also to existing Payday 2 DLC, buy 1 to get 2 so to speak.Get ready to begin the story of the original Payday crewAnd it'll not be as easy as Payday 2.Mask up

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												I bought this game on sale after I had so much fun playing PAYDAY 2, just to see how much PAYDAY 2 changed from PAYDAY: The Heist. I was surprised to find out they are like 2 completely different games!ABOUT THE GAME:Take on the role of a hardened career criminal executing intense, dynamic heists in constant pursuit of the next “big score”PROS:+ Fantastic level design (completely different missions unlike PD2)+ Vast variety of enemy types (cloakers, tasers, shields, dozers, its amazing)+ Can be very challenging and engaging (requires teamwork)+ Unique gameplay mechanics (taking hostages, restarting drills etc)+ Skills and equipment are cool (a little bit lacking of content)CONS:- You can't skip the opening cutscenes (makes repeating missions tedious)- Only a few missions (can make the game feel repetitive)- Interaction times are off (even with skills, restarting drill takes FOREVER)- Stealth mechanics suck (not really much to work with)- Connection problems (they happen often)SUMMARY:The game is a lot more simple than its predecessor PAYDAY 2, but it is still just as fun in it's on way. It is much more loud oriented and doesn't have much stealth in it, but makes working with your teammates to complete tough missions more satisfying.Final Grade:7 / 10 jammed drills

content:
Posted: January 25
												A game I find significantly more entertaining than the sequel. Do beware of some of its issues though. Enemies have divine accuracy, snipers are a nightmare, cloakers give no warning whatsoever and have virtually no OHKO cooldown, and tasers only need to see a small part of your playermodel to taze you and are extremely difficult to shake off single-handedly. The game can be frustrating with bots or incompetent pubs. The difficulty system also works differently than the sequel, with all difficulties capable of providing a challenge.PS: If you buy the game, make sure to get the Wolf Pack and Wolf Pack Weapons DLC. Sentry guns, machine pistols and grenade launchers. What's not to love?PPS: I mentioned the friendly AI before. I cannot stress how absolutely worthless they are. If you play with them with any frequency, you will rip your hair out as it takes them five seconds just to initiate a revive when they're right next to you. There is also no special that will not utterly wreck them. A single Shield trumps all three bots with ease. In other words; when possible, stick with multiplayer.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 17, 2015
												PAYDAY: The Heist is a first person shooter that allows players to embark on a spectacular and intense experience of a career criminal.The 6 original heists (First World Bank, Heat Street, Panic Room, Green Bridge, Diamond Heist and Slaughterhouse) provide a variety of approaches to achieve the best payday, including blasting the way through a downtown bank vault, managing hostages in an armored car hijacking and even a midnight infiltration of a high-security facility.This game challenges the player with dynamic environments and adaptive enemy tactics, which means that the scenarios will never be repeated, forcing the player to adapt to different situations every single time.The game features an amazing 4 players cooperative experience, and teamwork is essential to ensure the plan's success.The gameplay is good, the graphics are great in my opinion and the soundtrack is superb, although the AI could be improved.The released content provides 3 amazing new heists (Undercover, Counterfeit and No Mercy) and plenty of fun.I highly recommend PAYDAY: The Heist along with the Wolfpack DLC.

content:
Posted: January 15, 2016
												Much better than Payday 2. It lacks some features such as more advanced stealth and skill trees from Payday 2 but the gameplay is much better. There are no micro-payments, no skins. Just you, your buddies and your gun. Also, the difficulty is much higher, you actually have to be good at the game to play on Overkill difficulty! And no OP DLC will help you overcome that problem. Speaking of DLC. there is only one availible, and it adds much more than so called "DLC's" or money grabs in PD2. It adds 2 new heists, new unlocks, new weapons and the best part is that if your friends don't have the DLC maps they can still play with you if one player has the DLC! The levels are challenging and fun, the gameplay feels more tactical and Co-Op focused. I strongly reccomend this game over the "sequel".

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												This game is fantastic! If anyone is thinking about buying this then get it! It is one of those few games that make you feel rewarding and make you want to do more things. Payday The Heist is about four guys, Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf and Chains. You get to choose who you want to paly as and what heist you want to do. As you play and beat heists you will get money which is what you use to level up your class. There are 3 (4 if you get the DLC) classes that you get to level up. Each class has different weapons, crew bonuses and bags. The difficulty of the heists depend if you want to just have a normal experience. Overkill if you want to go hard. And easy which is only for the two heists for people who just started playing the game. Over all, this game is a fantastic FPS. If you are choosing to buy which Payday to buy first, get this one for starters. And remember, SHOOT THE BULLDOZER IN THE FACE!

Go go go go!Payday: The Heist is a fun objective game. Where you, the masked man, get all the money you can find. Collecting money from a crackhouse, getting a greedy teammate, to robbing a $20 Million Company of all its diamonds. And fight your way through police of all calibers. Team up with friends, have the perfect plan, and upgrade your arsenal with weapons and gear to make anyday a payday.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 24, 2015
												I bought this game on sale after I had so much fun playing PAYDAY 2, just to see how much PAYDAY 2 changed from PAYDAY: The Heist. I was surprised to find out they are like 2 completely different games!ABOUT THE GAME:Take on the role of a hardened career criminal executing intense, dynamic heists in constant pursuit of the next “big score” PROS: + Fantastic level design (completely different missions unlike PD2)+ Vast variety of enemy types (cloakers, tasers, shields, dozers, its amazing)+ Can be very challenging and engaging (requires teamwork)+ Unique gameplay mechanics (taking hostages, restarting drills etc)+ Skills and equipment are cool (a little bit lacking of content) CONS: - You can't skip the opening cutscenes (makes repeating missions tedious)- Only a few missions (can make the game feel repetitive)- Interaction times are off (even with skills, restarting drill takes FOREVER)- Stealth mechanics suck (not really much to work with)- Connection problems (they happen often) SUMMARY: The game is a lot more simple than its predecessor PAYDAY 2, but it is still just as fun in it's on way. It is much more loud oriented and doesn't have much stealth in it, but makes working with your teammates to complete tough missions more satisfying. Final Grade:7 / 10 jammed drills

content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												If you have any idea of what anything is, you should already know that Payday the heist is a four player co-op FPS. In which you rob stuff.You take the role of 1 of the 4 clowns in the payday crew, hitting banks, armoured transports, and more. This game is just fun to play, but frustrating at a few moments, just play it smart and you should stay out of trouble.Payday the heist feels like it's younger brother, Payday 2, so if you like Payday 2, this game is more of that and vice versa. It's not like they're exactly the same though, here are some notable differences:In PD:TH the heisters directly interact with bain, which makes bain that bit more likeable, instead of just the guy that nags at you.Cash is pretty much experience, when in the sequel it's two seperate things.Singleplayer actually works in PD:TH, since the companion AI revives you if you're down.The upgrade system is more simple and linear.There are much less weapons in PD:TH than there are in PD2, but that means you can decide what weapons you want alot easier.Overall, I have fun playing this game. I recommend it to anyone who likes co-operative fps games, because overkill sure kicks♥♥♥♥♥at making those.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2015
												I bought this game on sale after I had so much fun playing PAYDAY 2, just to see how much PAYDAY 2 changed from PAYDAY: The Heist. I was surprised to find out they are like 2 completely different games!ABOUT THE GAME:Take on the role of a hardened career criminal executing intense, dynamic heists in constant pursuit of the next “big score” PROS: + Fantastic level design (completely different missions unlike PD2)+ Vast variety of enemy types (cloakers, tasers, shields, dozers, its amazing)+ Can be very challenging and engaging (requires teamwork)+ Unique gameplay mechanics (taking hostages, restarting drills etc)+ Skills and equipment are cool (a little bit lacking of content) CONS: - You can't skip the opening cutscenes (makes repeating missions tedious)- Only a few missions (can make the game feel repetitive)- Interaction times are off (even with skills, restarting drill takes FOREVER)- Stealth mechanics suck (not really much to work with)- Connection problems (they happen often) SUMMARY: The game is a lot more simple than its predecessor PAYDAY 2, but it is still just as fun in it's on way. It is much more loud oriented and doesn't have much stealth in it, but makes working with your teammates to complete tough missions more satisfying. Final Grade:7 / 10 jammed drills

content:
Posted: February 21, 2014
												I will admit right off the bat, I'm not good at writing reviews. I will also admit that I do not care. This game deserves a review, and it's getting one. Anywho...PAYDAY: The Heist is, well, a bank heist simulator. Basic stuff: walk into a bank, put on a mask, shoot guards, keep civilians in check, etc. Also, if your computer is as bad as mine, you're destined to have framerate issues unless you have a custom config. I can understand this, because the graphics are amazing, the animations are realistic, and the amount of effort put into this game is overwhelmingly great. I bought this during the Winter Sale, at a low price of $2. Trust me, it's worth more than that. Its actual price is great for such a great game.+Awesome graphics+Realistic+Great price+Satisfies your criminal needs-Frustrating at moments, but that's part of the fun.-THOSE DAMN TASERSOverall 9/10

												The PAYDAY crew are here to rob banks, houses and hospitals.Featuring a colourful and funny cast of varying countries of origin and personalitiesHoxton the funny and my personal fav character from Sheffield, South Yorkshire, England.Dallas the calm, collected American member of the group and refered to by most as the group leader.Wolf the psychopathic member of the group, from Vallentuna, Sweden.Chains another american who is ex military and this games support.The game is incredibly fun and like its sequel is full of re-playability and brilliant gameplay, I personally love the co-op in this game and its a great way to spend time with friends and have a good laugh .9/10

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												Overall, this is a very fun game. The missions are quite balanced and give you a sense of accomplishment after making it to the end. Level design is varied and interesting. You have the ability to change your masks each round - something that most other games would charge extra for via DLC. The No Mercy tie-in with L4D is pretty spiffy as well. This is not a Counter-Strike clone by any means.The ONLY drawback is trying to play by yourself is near impossible for some missions. You quite literally cannot complete all tasks. Why? Because your computer-controlled teammates CAN shoot the enemies, but they CANNOT complete any of the mission objectives. You will be the one placing the saw, scooting the hostage along, placing the C4, etc. While this is possible in some missions, it is near impossible in others. For these, you MUST be playing with human players (and preferably ones that know what they are doing). :)Graphics 9/10Gameplay 10/10Sound/Voices 8.5/10Overall 9/10 - Worth every penny!

content:
Posted: May 6, 2012
												There are few co-op only FPS titles. Even L4D has "infected vs survivors" mode. My first impression of Payday was "juggalo FPS"; that alone made me NOT want to play it. Indeed, I always pick the raptor mask. If you hit Level 145 (ha!), you get the President masks from Point Break!See, this is a grand homage to robbery heists in contemporary crime drama cinema. The levels consist of a multitude of objectives, with a bit of randomness at points. Co-op here means more than Team DM. You NEED the voice chat, preferably with friends, and you need 4 people. Even then this game WILL kick your♥♥♥♥♥ If you don't coordinate with everyone AND plan things right, you WILL lose. Sure, you keep your XP (gain levels, get perks/guns/etc), but the devs keep adding content for the higher difficulties! I wish they'd make a tutorial. Mechanics aren't tricky, but you gotta figure out a lot.Shooting zombies, Nazis, & aliens is getting old. Shooting THE PO-LICE is where it's at. Especially with THIS music.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												Pro's- You get new weapons each time you level up. - It almost never gets boring playing the same mission.- Co-op is available, so you get to play with other people or buds.- Although this game isn't recent, OVERKILL made a new game as a sequel to this. (Payday 2, so more gaming is available).Con's- When someone is joining your game. (Already started) You'll have to wait a few. (Depending on their internet connection.) But you can disable that.- Payday The Heist isn't getting updated due to the recent game that OVERKILL released (Payday 2).In general, this game is awesome, and very fun to play with others. If you liked Payday The Heist, check out Payday 2!

content:
Posted: January 17, 2013
												This game is the 4-player co-op Left 4 Dead wanted to be!While in Left 4 Dead we were promised to get changing missions and alternative ways to finish them, they always stay the same - beside the different spawn(rate/places) of the enemies. In Payday the missions change: in lower difficulties only in details, but in higher ones you sometimes get other objectives.You get a nice set of different Heists to fullfil. Even a big homage to its main inspiring model Left 4 Dead by giving you the opportunity to play the non-canon events that leads to the outbreak of the infection.If you like such 4-player co-op games with real teamwork you should give this game a try!Not to forget it is a nice 'gun porn'. ;-)

content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												Great team based game. Fun levels and really challenging. The guns start off pretty bad, you miss point blank some how, but as you level up classes you upgrade them. To all good games, there must be some bad obviously. The AI are more stupid than dirt.. You run to the next objective, turn around, they are outside getting sniped.They are really slow to picking you up, so 1 small mistake with people (like say, getting hit by a cloaker) can be a huge mistake with AI teammates. Because they will run head first into him too..Also, on First World Bank there is a annoying glitch my and my friends keep falling into. Where you randomly slip through the floor and get stuck in walls. No way out as far as I can see.. 


So Overkill is like Valve and doesn't fix their bugs? All I did was Melee a cop and fell through the level and kept falling.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I was playing this game long time ago,on a pirate version,and now got it on Summer Sale 2014.I didnt enjoy it so much,when i was playing offline on pirate version,but now with friends,its so much better experience!I was playing PD2 a lot since now,because its also a good game,but requires more player skill than this one.+Verry easy to start playing,cuz you dont have much to care about.You got weapons,time on drill and hordes of cops,so what else you need in a robbery game :D+Does not require much time to level up and gain upgrades and peks for player.You also can upgrade any "tree" because at a point you will have all the skills in each tree.(sorry if im wrong at this part,didnt play the game so much)+A lot of fun with friends+Diference between dificulty levels is realy nice,since it truley awards players with more cash ;-) +Very replayable.I played in most part First World Bank mission,because i like it the most,and i didnt get bored,because i always gor something new for leveling up,new weapons,mods for them,new equipment,its upgrades armor upgrades,crew bonuses and other cool stuff.+Kind of hard achievements,wich make some kind of special "mission" for me and friends.+Chalenges for weapons and different actions,which award with money.This is even cooler because that makes some sense in changing your loadout.-Sometimes Specials are kind of owerpowered,for example Tasers are just a pain in the @ss if i were running around with locomotive and then get tased from middle of nowhere,and my friends are too far to help,or im just in wrong place.I cant blame anyone but myself,but sometimes they get realy annoying.-Graphics in general are not that BAD, but guys look at those masks,they are so low-poly and low-res textured,that cool looking heisters (in theory) look kinda....meh.Stock masks in PD2 are much better and look the way how it was suposed to be.-Shoot indicator.Sometimes is hard to realise where da hell from cops shoot at you.The screen just gets kind of red,but no indication of where are you been shot from.(Yes i now its not CoD but c'mon guys,wheni get shot from back and cant realise that its really sad)At final i would say the game is not bad,but i wouldnt recomend buying it at full price.Better wait for a sale or discount from Overkill,which they do quite offen,along with free PD2 weekends.P.S. Dont forget to buy Wolfpack DLC whic adds quitre cool stuff in the game.Hope this helps someone ;-)

content:
Posted: December 23, 2012
												This game is an amazing co-op shooter for a very moderate price. It's reasonably easy to learn, and yet takes quite a bit of practice to master the top difficulty!The two main goals of the game is to complete heists, and by doing so, earn "reputation" (XP) to unlock new weapons and gear, and upgrades for those weapons and gear. There's also plenty of challenges to keep you busy long after you hit max level! The Wolfpack DLC adds a new set of stuff, and also two new heists, so is well worth it. (Note: you can still join a game that's hosting a DLC map if you don't own the DLC, but you need to own the DLC to host those maps yourself)So buy this game, steal money, level up, and maybe, just maybe, you can get golden masks, if you're good enough. ;)

content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												It is a pure and simple FPS with those basic commands that we 've met players of this genre. Shoot, if copper works as a team to take down the enemy in the eye and sends bullet ammo again. It's a simple game mechanics, with standard gameplay that appeals greatly. I did not see difficulties or weaknesses in this regard. Beautiful graphics, no harm done. But the biggest storylines of the usual FPS is that you are the good guy. Go there and do good deeds, saves the day, saves the world. You can also be a criminal, which is part of a top-secret organization or fight in a place far away, for reasons unknown to the character. You are a common greedy villain of the big city. Your goal is to get out at predefined sites performing robbery ( as the name ' heist ', which means assault says ) with his group organized in co-op (online or with artificial intelligence). There are goals in the game, it's not just arrive and shouting " hands up ! " ( ! ) In the first phase, for example, before giving voice assault, it is advisable to find the bank manager to access a key that is required during this phase. That done, you have another set of goals that involve illegal activities to be performed for the success of the ' bad guys ' you control. While time passes, the police will appear at various levels. Securities local, public police, special police and SWAT Then the beast will catching! The peculiarity of the game is exactly this. Political correctness in the modern world totally left out. While in other shooters already see this, but not on this scale, not directly involving civil and common areas of the big city as banks. The downside of the game is that everything becomes repetitive at some point. The missions are basically all the same, just a different location. Your goal is always to kill and rob, kill and rob. There is nothing else to do throughout the game. After that, the only way to get fun again he is playing cooperatively with friends. For me, playing with friends always makes a " revival " in the game, especially when some of them have not played the game.Positives:    Simple graphics but well made ​​;    Proposal unusual storyline ;    Well organized Multiplayer multitasking ;    Nice and friendly gameplay .Negative    Repetitive game ;    Few game modes ;    Weak artificial intelligence.

content:

YouTube™ Video: Payday: The Heist - Review 

			Views: 11,444

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2016
												Going back to play Payday The Heist after a haitus of of playing Payday 2 you see a solid game on par with the sequel, The Heist excels in everything it goes to accomplish except possibly Animations, But this was an early title for the company off the Xbox 360 so one would make a few exceptions for it looking a little stiff, What you come to see is an expertly crafted Horde Shooter with the horde being Common Cops to Swat that are hell bent to take you out on every heist you go on by throwing numbers over fire power at you in an attempt to take your gang and yourself out, On the flip side your set out with a standard pistol, and assault rifle to work towards unlocking other weapons and upgrade them by unlocking more for it to continue to progress yourself by taking money as a main replacement for XP, The game features 9 Heists with entirely different scenerios for each with each having their own enviorment to work in giving you room to breath and room for the cops to come at you, If your wondering if Payday: The Heist is worth checking out after playing Payday 2 and having enjoyed it then you will most likely enjoy this as well, It holds up to be on par in the same aspect as L4D1 is to L4D2 since both titles share the same systems and enemies.The Game has 1 DLC in the form of the Wolf Pack, It includes 2 Heists a new Tree for unlocks [Weapons/Skills] and that's the extent, While seeming limited on the surface it is worthwhile to look towards getting this DLC on sale, Or simply with your purchase since it offers 2 compitent and well made maps that offer more to the expierence, Aswell as it gives you DLC for the second title Payday 2 in a similiarly named Wolf Pack that includes the same Maps and a Grenade Launcher  with a special Nail Gun as a melee.Note: The Heists for The Heist are currently being ported over to Payday 2, While being similiar they often take twists on the old maps to make them better, Or simply update them as they take them over, If your willing to wait eventually all the heists from 1 will be in 2 at some point, Currently there's 4/9 Heists on 2 as of this review.TL:DR: Payday: The Heist is a solid game and worth your time if your looking for something to play from time to time in the form of a horde shooter, It is on par with Payday 2 and holds up as it's own.

" ( ! ) In the first phase, for example, before giving voice assault, it is advisable to find the bank manager to access a key that is required during this phase. That done, you have another set of goals that involve illegal activities to be performed for the success of the ' bad guys ' you control. While time passes, the police will appear at various levels. Securities local, public police, special police and SWAT Then the beast will catching! The peculiarity of the game is exactly this. Political correctness in the modern world totally left out. While in other shooters already see this, but not on this scale, not directly involving civil and common areas of the big city as banks. The downside of the game is that everything becomes repetitive at some point. The missions are basically all the same, just a different location. Your goal is always to kill and rob, kill and rob. There is nothing else to do throughout the game. After that, the only way to get fun again he is playing cooperatively with friends. For me, playing with friends always makes a " revival " in the game, especially when some of them have not played the game.Positives:    Simple graphics but well made ​​;    Proposal unusual storyline ;    Well organized Multiplayer multitasking ;    Nice and friendly gameplay .Negative    Repetitive game ;    Few game modes ;    Weak artificial intelligence.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2014
												Heisters, put your gloves and lets hit the bank!.Payday The Heist puts you in the shoes of 4 bank robbers, Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf and Chains. You'll complete several missions involving bank heist (duh), diamond robbery's, drug dealers, or even blood transplants!. You have to survive waves of cops, swats and special enemies in an attempt to stop you and your 3 teammates. However, you don't have a large amount of weapons and gadgets to fight, but its not that much of a problem.  The game could be unforgiving and it's very hard in higher difficulties.The graphics aren't great but they are not bad, sound assets are quite good and animations are great. Sometimes, A.I is dumb , especially your A.I teammates. Yes, you can play this on singleplayer, but you won't get the same experience as in multiplayer, so if you want to play this game properly, get 3 friends and start having fun.The game doesn't feature a campaign, so I only recommend this if you're going to play multiplayer (the multiplayer missions are the same but with a better game experience). The music fits very well on every situation. The only big problem I could see in this game is the fact that it can get very repetitive very soon, as it only feature like 6 missions and they play the same way almost every time you replay them.

content:
Posted: April 14, 2015
												My crew and I have entered the bank and scoped the place out. Two of them find the bank manager, who has the keycard that we need; while I wait in queue at the tellers, and another teammate is upstairs with a view of the whole room.PRO:+ As a nice touch, killing civilians is a big no-no+ Your respawn timer is longer for each civilian you’ve killed.+ There are even some special police that require you to work together(co-op) to take down.+ Upgrades opening up as you gain reputation levels by collecting money+ It's even fun when you fail a mission and have to strategize with your team to figure out how to do better next time.+ Payday has some of the best music at the start and end of its heists that I’ve heard in a while.CONTRA- A major lack of communication- I had to use a Steam Forum to find out how upgrade system works- During the heists, there are a lot of objectives where you have to wait for something, but the game doesn’t always tell you how long you have to wait for.CONCLUSION:Stealing stuff has never felt this cool.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I was playing this game long time ago,on a pirate version,and now got it on Summer Sale 2014.I didnt enjoy it so much,when i was playing offline on pirate version,but now with friends,its so much better experience!I was playing PD2 a lot since now,because its also a good game,but requires more player skill than this one.+Verry easy to start playing,cuz you dont have much to care about.You got weapons,time on drill and hordes of cops,so what else you need in a robbery game :D+Does not require much time to level up and gain upgrades and peks for player.You also can upgrade any "tree" because at a point you will have all the skills in each tree.(sorry if im wrong at this part,didnt play the game so much)+A lot of fun with friends+Diference between dificulty levels is realy nice,since it truley awards players with more cash ;-) +Very replayable.I played in most part First World Bank mission,because i like it the most,and i didnt get bored,because i always gor something new for leveling up,new weapons,mods for them,new equipment,its upgrades armor upgrades,crew bonuses and other cool stuff.+Kind of hard achievements,wich make some kind of special "mission" for me and friends.+Chalenges for weapons and different actions,which award with money.This is even cooler because that makes some sense in changing your loadout.-Sometimes Specials are kind of owerpowered,for example Tasers are just a pain in the @ss if i were running around with locomotive and then get tased from middle of nowhere,and my friends are too far to help,or im just in wrong place.I cant blame anyone but myself,but sometimes they get realy annoying.-Graphics in general are not that BAD, but guys look at those masks,they are so low-poly and low-res textured,that cool looking heisters (in theory) look kinda....meh.Stock masks in PD2 are much better and look the way how it was suposed to be.-Shoot indicator.Sometimes is hard to realise where da hell from cops shoot at you.The screen just gets kind of red,but no indication of where are you been shot from.(Yes i now its not CoD but c'mon guys,wheni get shot from back and cant realise that its really sad)At final i would say the game is not bad,but i wouldnt recomend buying it at full price.Better wait for a sale or discount from Overkill,which they do quite offen,along with free PD2 weekends.P.S. Dont forget to buy Wolfpack DLC whic adds quitre cool stuff in the game.Hope this helps someone ;-)

content:
Posted: May 18, 2015
-Quick Review-PAYDAY: The Heist is a first person shooter developed by OVERKILL Software and released in 2011. The game can be played solo, or as 4-player co-op, you get to Heist 6 zones/areas and depending on events that occur within the game your play experience will change.-Detailed breakdown review-Story:  There isn't much to say about the story behind PAYDAY: the Heist, it's basically four robbers (Wolf, Dallas, Hoxton, and Chains) who teamed up to Rob the "First World Bank".Game Play: As has already been said, the game plays as a FPS but instead of just mindlessly gunning down civilians and cops, you need to be careful about who you shoot (You are penalized for killing civilians), and the game is objective oriented. In other words, "You could just kill cops for days, and your game would never end, or you can kill as little as possible and get experience faster."There is a level system within the game, you gain experience from picking up money/gems/currency, as you level up you unlock new weapons, tools, and armor.Achievements: The achievements on PAYDAY: the Heist are TOUGH, most of these require a solid team to play with, or a lot of determination/practice/luck. I haven't taken the time to start working on these achievements yet, I'm only sitting at 7 out of 56 achievements (05/18/15). I intend to try for more achievements, but most of them require specific conditions to be met, and "must be there at the start of the heist".Price: PAYDAY: The Heist is priced at $14.99, I personally picked up my copy on the 24 hour give away October 16, 2014. I recommend waiting for a sale to purchase this game. However if you're really into 4-player FPS's this is your game, and you can easily pump 20+ hours into this game, thereby justifying the purchase at full price.Conclusion: I've always felt that I'm not the best critic of these types of games since I spend most of my time playing by myself, or with one other friend. I enjoyed playing PAYDAY: The Heist, however I only played single player or with one friend.I would recommend this to people who already have friends they play 4 player games with, I could see Left 4 Dead fans easily getting attached to this game - if looking for a different flavor of 4-player-FPS.

												 "Players will embark on a spectacular crime spree of six heart stopping heists, including blasting their way through a downtown bank vault robbery, managing hostages in an armored car hijacking and even a midnight infiltration of a top-secret, high-security facility. Additionally, PAYDAY: The Heist challenges players with dynamic environments and adaptive enemy tactics - meaning no scenario will ever play out the same way twice. Teamwork is essential to ensure crew members provide cover under fire, guard key access points, break through various security measures and keep civilians in check. Survive wave after wave of the best that law enforcement can deploy as they shift strategies in response to player actions and gameplay style. Collapse" 7/10

content:
Posted: August 15, 2014
												Ok, I'd like to mention that the first time I played this was on an aweful computer, and it didn't actually work. It was also on one of Steam's free weekends. So imagine my delight when I got Payday 2 for the Xbox, and it worked. I loved the second and I wanted to experience the first game again, when it worked. So with a new computer, I bought the game and I absolutely love it. The missions are fun and you get stuck in (possibly too stuck in whilst robbing banks), and the missions are rarely the same the next time you play them, as different things can go wrong or right, and you never know what it's going to do until it's happened.Overall I love the game and would recommend it to any FPS fan... or proffesional bank robber, but that's not the point...

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 15, 2014
												This is an extremely addictive and challenging first-person shooter. It isn't necessarily the best game around, but it definitely is fun to play. There is a lot of farming involved with leveling up, but as you farm, your character gets better and you get more improved weapons. There is never a dull moment. Due to the randomization of the enemy spawn locations, no two levels are exactly the same. A guard could burst through a door in a level where that never happened before. The game keeps you on the edge of your seat, and it has the classic effect of making you want the rage quit once you die. However, the main setback of this game is that the AI (or your teammates) are absolutely terrible. They run about as fast as a rabbit with two broken legs, and you have to stop sprinting in order for them to keep up with you. Also, when you are down and are bleeding out, you usually have to shout out to them in order for them to actually come to your aid. But, setting this drawback aside, if you have friends to play with, the game will still be a fantastic co-op experience.My overall rating for this game will have to be an 8/10. It's not the best game in the world, but it is FAR from being the worst.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												The first Payday is a solid 4 player co-op FPS. I think it's better than Left 4 Dead in some ways. I prefer the graphical style and gameplay in this to the L4D series. Loads of stuff to unlock as you level up your character and plenty of challenges to complete in either single or multiplayer. Its been overtaken now by its successor, but remains a very playable game. Although clearly not designed as a single-player game, I think its still pretty good as a single-player game, better than L4D single-player IMO.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2015
What is PAYDAY:The Heist and why should I get it ?PAYDAY: The Heist is a fantastic game, and it's 10 times better with friends. Personally, I think the new Wolf Pack DLC is worth it, as you get new weapons and gadgets (including a sentry gun and grenade luancher). The game might not look as stunning as PAYDAY 2, but in my own personal opinion, it is a tad bit better. You better be wary of hackers though, they lurk in the deepest depths of the servers. Intense combat and interesting heists, there's never a dull moment. Unless your trying to repair a drill with half your crew lying on death's frontdoor. The game has many pro's, but it's not perfect.Pro's You get exactly what you paid for. Wide viriaty of weapons, gadgets, heists and enemies. Extremely satisfying gameplay. 4 playeble characters each with a set of unique masks. Skill trees (Assualt / Sharpshooter / Support / (DLC) Technician). Amazing soundtrack. Smooth textures, the laws of gravity apply to objects most of the time. You can cause law enforcers to surrender and cuff themselfs. Actually have to plan instead of mindlessly storming in, gun blazing. Or you can just plan to storm in mindlessly, gun blazing, BUT in a fashionable order. You have to take hostages to trade in your friends from custody (if they die or are cuffed) Good enemy A.I.Con's You need human players to interact with objectives, take hostages, grab money ect. Bad ally A.I. I'll understand if the drill jammes one or two times but jamming almost 5 times per heist is rediculous. Heroic civileans get in the crossfire between you and the feds. I don't know if this is a glitch but you can revive and use explosive/medical/ammo bags through walls. Cloakers are one hit kills, bieng able to incapitate/cuff you with a simple kick. Stealthing is nearly impossible without a legitemate team that communicate. Paintings fall on top of trip mines and render them useless. Those same painting's have somekind of superpower of not moving once shot again. Feds are on steriods, they never get tired when scaling buildings or parkouring from roof to roof. No awesome music while stealthing. Hackers, hackers everywhere.... Bugs that cause people to become Hoodini or something, bieng able to shoot a law enforcer, than they take a one-way ticket to space, Shooting a law enforcer and then they swan dive through objects, or getting downed and glitch under the map.Conclusion.I highly recommend this game if you have friends to play it with, and if you really want to, then you can add me to join you. The excitement of getting away with 25,000,000 $ feels amazing, but the suspense builds up to that last moment where you just need to get to the escape vehicle.... Now two things can happen at this point: A. You make it and then you're, well, as Bain puts it "We're set for life guys" and B. You can get horifically murderd by swarming cloakers, bulldozers, or the Tazer-brigade. This is a must have for anyone that likes to plan, play, execute and succeed if you play with a team of friends. The last time I checked this game isn't getting updated anymore, but it's good as it is. "Speed is key" a wise irishman once said, but that only applies to Heat street. The best way to go is "Sneaky-beaky like". If you have $15 dollars to spare, then be sure to pick this up and join me in my quest to steal cash/gold/blood/diamonds/cash molds. ~~Ashe~~

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												After playing every level (including DLC), I have decided to make yet another review. This game is basically Criminal Simulator 2011. You can choose from four criminal masterminds: Dallas, the Assault; Hoxton, the Sharpshooter; Chains, the Support; Wolf, the Technician (Wolf Pack DLC). Each character has special items, such as trip mines, a sentry gun, and cable ties. You can play six campaigns (two more with Wolf Pack) ranging from trying to catch a traitorous burgular who has stolen your money, to stealing counterfeit money, to a classic bank robbery. A customization option is the masks. You can have the classic "Clowns" or the rotting "End of the World", or perhaps the random "BEEEEF!" mask (my favorite). The best thing is that the masks change depending on which character you pick (besides End of the World). I got this game on sale for $1.50 and the Wolf Pack DLC for a buck, but as I played I figured out that the original $15 price point is perfectly fine! This game will entertain you for a while, and is unlike any other FPS. I highly recommend this game and challenge anyone to get to the reputation max (with DLC), which is 193. Good luck!

content:
Posted: March 22, 2014
												Although being very difficult, Payday: The Heist does a great job at making co-operation an important part of completing a heist. The AI in this game have their ups and downs (like doing suicide runs if someone is downed) but is not a problem as the game is designed for (and in my opinion, more entertaining with) human players. So if you are looking for a co-op game that is fast-paced aswell as being challenging, this game could be for you.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2014
												Heisters, put your gloves and lets hit the bank!.Payday The Heist puts you in the shoes of 4 bank robbers, Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf and Chains. You'll complete several missions involving bank heist (duh), diamond robbery's, drug dealers, or even blood transplants!. You have to survive waves of cops, swats and special enemies in an attempt to stop you and your 3 teammates. However, you don't have a large amount of weapons and gadgets to fight, but its not that much of a problem.  The game could be unforgiving and it's very hard in higher difficulties.The graphics aren't great but they are not bad, sound assets are quite good and animations are great. Sometimes, A.I is dumb , especially your A.I teammates. Yes, you can play this on singleplayer, but you won't get the same experience as in multiplayer, so if you want to play this game properly, get 3 friends and start having fun.The game doesn't feature a campaign, so I only recommend this if you're going to play multiplayer (the multiplayer missions are the same but with a better game experience). The music fits very well on every situation. The only big problem I could see in this game is the fact that it can get very repetitive very soon, as it only feature like 6 missions and they play the same way almost every time you replay them.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												- many cheaters- sometimes AI- more and more players start play payday 2 +/- bugs (It´s up to you if you use it or not like: Helping your downed friend through the wall)+ Prize and also DLCs (only 2)+ 4 characters, and each with funny quotes+ a lots of different types of masks+ COOP for 4 players+ 145 levels (193 with DLC)+ weapons, crew bonuses, bags ( - less than in PAYDAY 2)+ many types of law forces+ steam adds (interesting achievements, trading cards, statistics etc.)So, I am very big fan of this Coop game, where you take a role like one of the 4 robbers (Dallas, Hoxton, Chains and Wolf). You start with M4 and M9 pistol like level 0 (there is reputation, not level) and you will stealing jewelery, gold or money in 8 maps (with DLC). Yeah, the true is that if you played PAYDAY 2 I think you won´t like it, cause here´s only a few weapons and upgrades, bonuses, and not a RPG part like in payday 2. But If you won´t play PAYDAY 2 or If you was big fan of Payday 2 and you wanna take a look How our group looks before Hoxton gets to Prison you should buy it. All in all: 92%

												 "Players will embark on a spectacular crime spree of six heart stopping heists, including blasting their way through a downtown bank vault robbery, managing hostages in an armored car hijacking and even a midnight infiltration of a top-secret, high-security facility. Additionally, PAYDAY: The Heist challenges players with dynamic environments and adaptive enemy tactics - meaning no scenario will ever play out the same way twice. Teamwork is essential to ensure crew members provide cover under fire, guard key access points, break through various security measures and keep civilians in check. Survive wave after wave of the best that law enforcement can deploy as they shift strategies in response to player actions and gameplay style. Collapse" 7/10

content:
Posted: May 18, 2015
-Quick Review-PAYDAY: The Heist is a first person shooter developed by OVERKILL Software and released in 2011. The game can be played solo, or as 4-player co-op, you get to Heist 6 zones/areas and depending on events that occur within the game your play experience will change.-Detailed breakdown review-Story:  There isn't much to say about the story behind PAYDAY: the Heist, it's basically four robbers (Wolf, Dallas, Hoxton, and Chains) who teamed up to Rob the "First World Bank".Game Play: As has already been said, the game plays as a FPS but instead of just mindlessly gunning down civilians and cops, you need to be careful about who you shoot (You are penalized for killing civilians), and the game is objective oriented. In other words, "You could just kill cops for days, and your game would never end, or you can kill as little as possible and get experience faster."There is a level system within the game, you gain experience from picking up money/gems/currency, as you level up you unlock new weapons, tools, and armor.Achievements: The achievements on PAYDAY: the Heist are TOUGH, most of these require a solid team to play with, or a lot of determination/practice/luck. I haven't taken the time to start working on these achievements yet, I'm only sitting at 7 out of 56 achievements (05/18/15). I intend to try for more achievements, but most of them require specific conditions to be met, and "must be there at the start of the heist".Price: PAYDAY: The Heist is priced at $14.99, I personally picked up my copy on the 24 hour give away October 16, 2014. I recommend waiting for a sale to purchase this game. However if you're really into 4-player FPS's this is your game, and you can easily pump 20+ hours into this game, thereby justifying the purchase at full price.Conclusion: I've always felt that I'm not the best critic of these types of games since I spend most of my time playing by myself, or with one other friend. I enjoyed playing PAYDAY: The Heist, however I only played single player or with one friend.I would recommend this to people who already have friends they play 4 player games with, I could see Left 4 Dead fans easily getting attached to this game - if looking for a different flavor of 4-player-FPS.

content:
Posted: October 28, 2015
												So, Payday 2 feels too casual or you just hate its irrational weapon balance? Welcome to the roots!So, here, like in PD2, we have:- Our favorite specials:-- Dozers: simple Dooo.... Wait, WHAT?! HE'S SPRINTIIIIIIING!!!-- Cloakers: nothing to worry about in the silence of the night... AAAHHH!!! Get away from me! GET AAAWAAAY!!! HELP!!!-- Tazers: just Ta-a-a-a-a-azzzzzzze-e-e-e-erzzzzz!!! ZZZ! ZZZZ!!! *on the ground, no ammo*-- Snipers: yes, those little black dots far away out there! You mean which red lazers? Naah, that couldn't be so easy, could it?- Difficulty levels:-- Easy: or is it?-- Normal: no, you really should start with easy!-- Hard: oh, yes, you, courageous one! Heard of loud Death Wish yet?-- Overkill: would you like your a$$ served you on a plate rare or well-burnt?-- 145+: well, oh well!.. Now you will die! ...and die! ...and die...And, unlike PD2:- The FPS are great, but the network code is soooo sloooow.- There's no wrong "bound-to-fail" setup - you can make any one work, even with a "wrong" weapon.- Skill-trees, that you gradually unlock - feature by feature, no skipping, but you'll eventually get them all for every tree (don't forget about that <Tab + 1...4> button combination during heists).- You have no "gray screen" for the last down before custody, but you can tell it is by the health you get back (with every down on lower difficulty levels it decreases: 75% -> 50% -> 25% -> go get your medbag heal NOW!).- No First Aid Kits, so either you go down and hope your buddies will get you up (no Inspire either!), or screw your team's medical supplies (and get kicked for being selfish!)!- Fast-paced raw hardcore experience, where you can only win with skill and team effort on anything harder than Normal.- Yeah, no weapon skins!Give this one a chance! It might just be your thing!

												Do you like Left4Dead? Do you like shooting those pesky enforcers of the law while you aquire currency? Then this is the game for you! Grab 3 friends while you plan and execute the heist of your dreams (six in all!) Unlike those zombies in L4D, these cops shoot BACK, so prepare for some hijinks on the run with all that loot! And if you order right now, you get 3 AI teammates if you dont have any friends, ABSOLUTELY FREE. Heres HOW TO ORDER!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2013
												Payday is a fun co-op game, but it lacks polish.The maps are of uneven quality and difficulty. There is frequently a feeling of "what do I do next?” with inadequate guidance from the game. It helps to play with experienced players, but when you do, you're dragging your team down because you don't have all the levelling perks that they do.There also seem to be many ways to game each level. Beating levels seems to be less about adapting on the fly, and more about knowing exactly where to hide out while you're waiting for events to happen. And you do spend a lot of time in this game waiting for stuff to happen.But past the flaws, Payday is a game with a cheap $20 price tag. There is a certain breeziness to the gameplay that's just a rollicking good time.  The harder difficulty levels require teamwork and planning, which I appreciate. Payday delivers a satisfying co-op experience, of which there are too few today. Really – if judged solely for its “co-op-iness”, this game is top-flight… playing on a well-coordinated team is a great experience.I want to mention that you kill a lot of cops in Payday. A lot.  There's no stealth element here. Through the years, shooters have given us a variety of enemies to gun down of increasingly human-like appearance:  Aliens, robots, zombies, soldiers. Criminals occasionally appeared, especially mobsters. But cops? These aren't even "corrupt cops.” Call me squeamish, but I find this ... distasteful.All in all, Payday is a good game, even if it’s a bit rough around the edges. The soon-to-be-released sequel appears to be a much more ambitious effort. I hope the developers will be able to apply what they’ve learned from this game to the new one.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2014
												Super fun game. I enjoy how I get to level my character and unlock items and abilities. Super fun to play with a full party of friends. Interesting levels, the difficulty settings are good. I particularly enjoy difficult settings and play on hardest difficulty whenever I can, this game certainly can be difficult on harder settings and is no easy feat.I was gifted it when it was on Sale a friend bought a 4 pack for like 6 or 8 bucks an I was lucky enough to be gifted it. It was so good, I bought the game on a 2$ coupon sale I unlocked from a badge I made with steam trading cards, and gifted a friend, who then in turn gifted HIS friend a copy as well so we could all play together. WILL be uploading some expert level heists onto my YouTube channel hopefully in the next couple weeks. Great game, hope I am lucky enough to be able to play the second one as well. Well worth the deal, would still even pay 10 bucks for it.8/10

content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												The easiest way for me to explain PAYDAY: The Heist is this: Its a game that encourages teamwork. This game is still playable, even to today's standards of gaming. One thing I like about PAYDAY: The Heist is that it makes you feel more vulnerable. When I say more vulnerable, I mean you can't be as tanky as in PAYDAY 2. If you like references to Left 4 Dead, Army Of Two, Jurassic Park, and even Battlefield, then you'll like this game. They have other references in the game as well, but they're a little harder to understand since they're based off memes and so forth. All and all, PAYDAY: The Heist is awesome and I would reccommend buying it when it goes on sale. It usually goes on sale around the end of the year or so. Also pick up the Wolfpack DLC if it goes on sale. It gives you more things to level up, as well as the heists Counterfeit and Undercover. Other than that, there's nothing else I can say about this game, its just that much fun. This has been Spectral Destroyer 65, and I hope you all enjoyed this review. Take care and have a great day.
