content:
Posted: August 20, 2013
												Everyone deserves a Payday but are you up for a challenge ? In payday you can play as four charecters Dallas, Hoxton, Chains and Wolf And you have to pull of the perfect heist. This game doesnt have any real story to it  its just random heist that have theyre own short story to them. This game is really fun and has really tight shooting controls. The sound effects is what really makes this game way more fun. You can here realistic gun sounds and awesome adrenaline pumping soundtrack that makes you want to go on a murderous rampage. The game in itself does get difficult but thats okay because i would believe robbing a real bank in the real world wouldnt be easy. This game also offers 4 player co op action which is alot of fun if you have friends to play this game. Overall the game is really fun with a bunch of little and simple things that make it way more fun i would give the main game a 9/10Now lets talk about the Wolfpack dlc. It adds two new heist Undercover and Counterfeit. Undercover is really hard so i would suggest having a good with you.The dlc is really good and if you purchase the main game you really need to get the dlc im giving this dlc a 7/10

content:
Posted: July 23, 2015
												Ok, After more than 700 hours played i will say this.PAYDAY: THE HEIST is a coop game developed by Overkill Software - A Starbreeze Studio.in this game you can be 1 of 4 robbers. Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf And Chains.PAYDAY: The Heist is really hardcore, then plp like cheat but you can download a anti-cheat mod called DorHUD.PAYDAY: The Heist Is a Good Game, but have a REALLY STUPID COMMUNITY, Overdrillers,Cheaters,etc then i recomend play in privates with friends or offline.The Performanse is Good in a toaster (Intel HD Graphics 4000 and Intel Celeron G1610)a exelent Graphic Quality for a 2011 game and a exelent game experience.You Have 4 Skill Tree:Assault: Bring Ammo Bag, Increase Damage And Armor. New Weapons: Mark 11, Crosskill .45Sharpshooter: Bring Trip Mines, Increase Accurassy, New Weapons: M308, LocomotiveSupport: Bring Doctor Bag, Increase Player Heal, New  Weapons: Bronco .44, Reinfield 880, Compact 5Technical{DLC}: Bring Sentry, Increase Player Armor and Interaction Speed, New Weapons: Styrk, AK Rifle, GL 40 Grenade Launcheryou have 9 heists(2 from Wolf Pack DLC).First World Bank: the only heist from beta game, now lets talk about this heist, It's horrible. on every lobbies you can see Noobies with 1 - 120 hours played farming levels (overdrill). then the noobs reach +145 rep and they goes to play Overkill +145 Difficulty, ruining Pro Players games and trolling.Heat Street:I don't know much about this Heist because every time that I try to play this, I found cheaters.The basic is: It's A Really Hard HEIST, Matt Scape in the van. you follow him, burn the van to make Matt exit from the van and scort him to the helicopter.Panic Room:You and the gang go to Mendoza's "safehouse" to make a drug deal, but the truth you go to stealth the "Vault" from the panic room, put your mask on and find Chavez and get his key, open the panic room and saw it, wait for the C4, secure the roof and plant the C4 In Roof And 5th and 4th floor, go away from the C4(2nd floor or above) to can detonate, wait for the helicopter, put the Magnet in the "vault" and secure the roof and scape.Diamond Heist:You and the gang go to steal diamonds from a vault, you can do it in stealth or loud, Stealth: disable the alarm boxes and enter the codes, break the clases, grab the diamonds, wait for bain and scapeLoud: hack the alarm boxes, enter the codes, find and get the CFO and scort him to roof, find Ralph(CFO son) and scort to the roof, wait for vault open and grab the diamonds, wait for bain and scape.Green Bridge: You and the gang go to the "Green Bridge" to explode him and free the Chinesse guy from the police turk, saw the 4 turks and find him, scort the chinesse to scaffold and free the ballon, wait for the plane and scape.Slaughterhouse:you and the gang are waiting for a GenSec Turk, attack him, open the turk with the C4 and drill the safe, bag the gold and hide in the container, make a smoke screen, prepare a trap, move the containers and scape.Counterfeit {DLC}:Go To Mitchell's house, hack the devices, find a crowbar and open the gates, get in shelter, investigate the safe, place the drill in the safe, connect the drill, connect the hosepipe to the safe and open the water, explode the safe and grab the plates and the diamonds, scape.Undercover {DLC}:wait fir the deal, get the limo, saw the limo, find a crowbar and open the limo, grab the server, scort the penpusher to pc and get the the codes, transfer the money and scape.No Mercy [PC ONLY]:Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf And Chains go to Mercy Hospital monts before the infection, saw the door, saw the fence, find the patient, draw blood form the patient, verify the blood and wait for elevator, get in elevator and scape.8/10

9.5/10 ExcellentPAYDAY: The Heist is a co-operative, "cops and robbers"-themed game, except you always play as the cool robber. It has a very high fun factor.Slightly more of a shooter than it's successor, with a decent amount of content (additional content is available with the purchase of the Wolfpack DLC) and virtually endless hours of fun and challenge, and despite a very small number of trivial glitches/bugs and a relatively limited playerbase, PAYDAY: The Heist is here to steal your heart.I cannot help but recommend it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 3, 2013
												As Payday 2 soon arrives, I highly recommend  playing Payday The Heist, not only to get the feel for the series, but also to experience this amazing first person, tactical shooter. Payday has hours of gameplay promise, and if you put the time into it, you can get guns, supplies, and other items to help you in the many heists you will be encountering! For the price, no game matchs the unique payday!Concept: No storyline at all really, but each heist has a different feel to it. 80/100Graphics: I like the way its presented, it feels very easy to get the hang of, but a lot of the items in the game have low detail and low resolutions. Not to mention there are barely any different character models! 70/100Sound: Sound effects are very detailed and crisp, and everything sounds very HD. 85/100Playability: Gunplay feels fantastic and keyboard/mouse is implemented nicely! 90/100Entertainment: The game is just extremely fun and very unique! Worth a few playthroughs! 100/100Replay Value: Very highOverall Score: 85/100

content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
												This game is pretty good. Somewhat realistic heist system, other than the fact that they send the whole US Army/SWAT Team/Police Force against 4 guys robbing a bank.....And destroying cameras limits assault waves to almost zero. This game has almost no replay value if you're playing by yourself, and playing with random people can really ruin it. I say get a group of people you know, start a voice chat of some sort, start the game and start robbing, this way you can direct orders without stopping to type.....Its also really hard without the assistance of at least 1 other person. The first heist is so much easier if you have a second real life person with you so that they can pick up the extra can of thermite, and package money with you.Its fun, can be a real rage game at times....like if you play overkill mode....or try to go stealth and fail. Good game though. Wait for it to go on sale before buying it though....$20 isn't a good price for this game. Do like I did and get it when its about 5 dollars. Maybe even 10 or 15.

content:
Posted: February 2, 2014
												This game is definitely worth buying, even though it's true that there is a very short amount of maps / missions to play. The experience also massively improves when playing with friends. I played some missions alone, but the AI isn't too good objective wise, therefor playing co-op improves the game experience positively. Although there aren't many levels for this game, the ones that are there all provide an unique and fun playing experience. It's safe to say that all the levels are very good, not only graphics wise but also gameplay wise. Not only is it ver hard to complete the levels, even if you do they still stay challanging. You'll find yourself playing the same levels multiple times without being bothered too much, and if you do get bored there is also a second version of this game :).The combat is decent, you might have to tweak around with some settings to prevent mouse lag but when everything is running smooth then you'll have no problems moving yourself around in this

												This is yet another post-millennium LAN-only game that will likely lead the developers to doom; since this game requires far too many coordinated, available players for it to be a mass-market success. It's unfortunate, as Payday The Heist is a fairly solid and enjoyable game, but ONLY if all of the players use voice chat and have some clue as to what is going on. This game is otherwise insufferable with random groups of trigger happy nubs. I suggest buying this game for a LAN party, otherwise pass... And that's unfortunate. This game would have been a gem in the LAN gaming age.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												Having bought this game during it's fantastic 90% off sale, This game is a tremendous amount of fun. Obviously no game is without it's flaws, which in PAYDAY consist of sometimes tedious gunplay and very very undetailed texture models on certain characters within the game. However, the co-op elements help the game move past these issues very well by utilising fun heists which must be pulled off with stealth and precision. All in all, If you're a fan of tactical, fast paced, co-op FPS's, then this game is a must have. 32/37 ChiggStars.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Payday: The Heist is an amazingly fun game. I like how simple, independent games like these always manage to get me to sink many more hours into it than any of the higher budget titles that are out.Unlike most shooters out, Payday forces you to play realistically. Your goal is not to rack up a body count, but to perform a heist. When a Rambo tries to run into the open, and play the bad♥♥♥♥♥ they end up getting horribly♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ arrested, and then left behind as his teammates progress through the stage. The game just has a really intense feel as you yell at civilians to drop to the floor and shoot out surveillance cameras in preparation for police arrival.I have seen quite a few complaints about the AI being 'too sentry,' but imo, it is very realistic. The task force units feel professional and trained as I would expect any officer charging into a bank heist, or general hostage situation, would be. However, they are quite careless about shooting around civilians and you will often find yourself feeling like you are trying to save innocents from a reckless police riot. This game is made to be a Pure Teamwork Tactic and it's very important to make strategy and then excecute the plan, overall. Don't buy this game if you don't have friends to play with, sincerely you'll face having a hard time in heist. I recommend you should play in Co-op with your friends because of the needs to stick together, tactics and teamwork.Rated: 9.4/10

content:
Posted: July 3, 2012
												Throw Left 4 Dead and the 1995 movie Heat and you got Payday : The Heist. This isn't really just L4D with cops. It's got it's own original gameplay than was L4D has. There's a level progression tree that can earn you weapons, equipment and upgrades. 5 memorable heists with a DLC on the way. And Endless replayability. It's just 5 heists but they are worth replaying over and over. Your skill gets better everytime you play. I recommand this game to anyone who likes co op games/ or a big L4D player. The community is small, only to have at least 400 active players but they are dedicated and the community should last for a while.8.5/10

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
												This game makes you rely on teamwork and planning to pull of difficult and rewording missions. Each heist is different and require different stratagies to beat. To set yourself apart from other players their are three branching skill trees. Each time you level up either by combat, objectives, or beating a heist you gain a upgrade or item in your skill tree, making you truly feel like a badass heister. The combat is difficult and without bugs. Hostages are a interesting feature, if one of your men are captured you can trade them for a hostage your took. Objectives are interesting and fun. I would say the main drawback is how often during heist you put a drill to a lock and protect it from wave after wave of enemies, which gets repetitive after a while. If the game is on sale, buy it for a friend and play together, co-op is increadably alongside a true hommie.

content:
Posted: June 9, 2015
												This game is bad, if you have to play with bots, but if you find three other people, a good first person action will wait for you. There are six original heists. Its not too much, but there is DLC, which adds two more challenging heists.Weapons are okay, M308 and AK are better than in PAYDAY 2 and GL40 is really useful here to kill large groups of enemies, because you dont have any grenades or molotovs.The hardest difficulty is a real challenge and without cooperation is impossible to beat it (Deathwish difficulty in PAYDAY 2 is piece of cake against OVK 145+).Bots are stupid (nothing new), they don´t listen to you, if you call them and they are weak. One positive here, they at least kill snipers (in PAYDAY 2 they don´t).If you´re playing with bots - 3/10If you´re playing with friends - 8,5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
												Recently bought the game as i wanted to play with a friend i have tried payday 2 and gameplay is a bit better but my god the replayability in this game is amazing. It has never been so fun just doing the same heist again and mastering them. And no micro transactions ;). I fell in love with the game right at the start. However, if you want to play online with other people this is not your game. So many people have left this game for payday 2 so there are little to no players hosting a game. However, if your a person who likes to 100% complete game achievements, this is your game this game offers the hardest achievements to unlock( In my opinion) but when done brings a lot of satisfaction to one self. Take it from me i recommend this game to anyone looking to play with friends on game night or just spending some time killing off waves of AI. Just keep in mind online gameplay isn't the strong suit of this game anymore but out of everything i give it a 8/10 for 2016.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
												One of the sleeper hits of Steam, I really enjoy PAYDAY. Coming from over 2000hrs played of Left4Dead 2, I was looking for something in a similar play style where you have to really rely on your teammates. Although this misses out on any form of versus play, the cooperative mechanic is dead on. You are rewarded for precision hits against the AI, and at times that precision is required (I HATE BULLDOZERS). The goal oriented objectives puts a unique spin on cooperative play...but better yet are the options to stealth missions. Being able to stealthily acheive your goals without alerting police takes patience and practice, not to mention 3 other Player Characters that you can count on. Microphones are a must for stealth, and a real joy to play. The game is easy to learn but challenging to master, but well worth the time investment. Huge re-playability in this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												PAYDAY: The Heist is a 4 player co-op FPS made by OVERKILL Software.In this game, you assume the role of one heister in doing multi-million dollar heists, including robbing a bank, to stealing a multitude of diamonds.The game has a limited span of weapons for use, and only has the AMCAR (M4/M16) and the b9-S (silenced pistol). The game has 145-193 (depending on the DLC you have) levels, all suited for full completion of the 4 skill trees. These specalize in Assault (damage), Support (Medical), Sharpshooter (Snipers, and accuracy) and Technician (Grenades, fixing stuff).The game has music made by Simon Viklund, and are unique to each heist.The heists, even if there are few, are very fun and unique. First World Bank - Robbing a bank Heat Street - Chasing a helper gone rogue through a city Green Bridge - Rescuing a Chinese Prisoner via blowing up a bridge. Diamond Heist - as the name entails, stealing diamonds, and one of the few stealth missions. Slaughterhouse - Chasing an armored van filled with gold into a slaughterhouse, where you drill it open and steal said gold. Counterfeit[DLC] - Going to Florida and stealing someones counterfeiting plates. Undercover[DLC] - Stealing an IRS server for the money. No Mercy - Stealing blood from a patient, L4D crossover.The game is, however, without flaws. The games graphics are eh, and use an outdated engine from 2001. The game is easy to hack and mod, however custom heists don't exist (and probably won't but a man can dream). Heists can also get repetitive, grinding up to 145/193. This game can get very VERY difficult when going into OVK 145+.I would reccomend this game, but get the game with friends to experience the game together. And if possible, buy the Wolf DLC.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2012
												Fast paced, team based (sp/a.i. or mp) game built around bank heists. Created by Overkill and published by SOE, this game released only to PC via Steam and Ps3 download. There are multiple objectives for each heist and the pressure stays on the whole mission, you can't cake walk through this one. If you like a fast-paced, first person, team based game that relies heavy on team work (rambos need not apply), then I suggest giving this game a try. The devs are in the Steam forums always getting community feedback and supporting their game and even recently added more free content -a new map/mission that they did with Valve (No Mercy- L4D level done the payday way ;) ). I love great games like these, (I've never had a bug)  that are released and not abandoned by the developer shortly after release. This one is still getting the love. Single player is fun and mp is still alive and well, no problems finding games.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Payday: The Heist is an amazingly fun game. I like how simple, independent games like these always manage to get me to sink many more hours into it than any of the higher budget titles that are out.Unlike most shooters out, Payday forces you to play realistically. Your goal is not to rack up a body count, but to perform a heist. When a Rambo tries to run into the open, and play the bad♥♥♥♥♥ they end up getting horribly♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ arrested, and then left behind as his teammates progress through the stage. The game just has a really intense feel as you yell at civilians to drop to the floor and shoot out surveillance cameras in preparation for police arrival.I have seen quite a few complaints about the AI being 'too sentry,' but imo, it is very realistic. The task force units feel professional and trained as I would expect any officer charging into a bank heist, or general hostage situation, would be. However, they are quite careless about shooting around civilians and you will often find yourself feeling like you are trying to save innocents from a reckless police riot. This game is made to be a Pure Teamwork Tactic and it's very important to make strategy and then excecute the plan, overall. Don't buy this game if you don't have friends to play with, sincerely you'll face having a hard time in heist. I recommend you should play in Co-op with your friends because of the needs to stick together, tactics and teamwork.Rated: 9.4/10

												This game is good, it really is. Don't get me wrong, it can be pretty fun when playing with close friends and a mic, but it has some serious glaring issues. Just repeat that step 3 or 5 times until they are hacked.* If you can put up with an insane amount of backtracking, then this game is perfect for you. Gameplay wise, it's basically what I just said, and lots of shooting.If you have any friends (As I don't-Forever Alone) then this game is very fun.VERDICT:Past the glaring issue(s), this game is great.8.9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 17, 2015
												I really like this game from the start, but there are a few things I don't like and many people would care to disagree with these statements. I have heard that Payday 2 got some bad reviews after the "microtransactions" thing, but this game is better. First, we have the rank up system. It takes forever to rank up and get cool stuff; my friend bought me the DLC "wolf Pack" and I immediately thought I was going to already have the new weapons and equipment unlocked. that was not the case. Second, I would like to point out that the starting weapons are Peashooters and you can't get a kill with any of them (you get a crappy assault rifle and supressed pistol). Third, even on the lowest difficulty, you get killed too easily and that makes the game repetitive because you have to rely on other people (and AI) to help you up and you don't get your health back or anything else. Fourth, threre are a lot of glitches. On multiple occassions, I have seen enemies flying around like the have "noclip" on and enemies running through walls and barriers, which can be either frustrating or funny. Lastly, the game could do with a few more "heists" because the ones that are there now get repetitive because there is only about 7 of them and they consist of you: shooting cops and SWAT team members, dying, grabbing money (gold, Diamonds, etc.), tying up hostages, accidentally shooting Civilians because you thought they were cops, and objectives the require you to repetitively run back and fourth. I know this review sound negative, but I think this game is fun. I would like to see more work done with this game, even though Overkill probably won't add to or fix an old game, but it could have more "heists", more types of enemies, more weapons, a new (and better) rank up system, and possibly better (or different) starting weapons. Overall, I think it's fun to play with my Friends.

content:
Posted: May 15, 2012
												Tight gunplay, decent graphics, so-bad-it's-good voiceovers, and killer music [by the always incredible Simon Viklund] make this game a standout. It's kind of like L4D without a versus mode; only teamwork is genuinely required here. If your team doesn't have it together, good luck trying to clear a heist even on Easy.With 145+ levels to upgrade and three different class branches to flesh out, six heists in-game [In locations like a bank, a gang hideout, and even major city streets in one heist],and more promised via cheap DLC; plus free events & difficulties being added via patches, this game is a gigantic steal for $20. If you're looking for a new zombie-free co-op game that will put your group of friends through the wringer, this is it.Friendly warning: Watch out for the Bulldozers. :P

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
												One of the sleeper hits of Steam, I really enjoy PAYDAY. Coming from over 2000hrs played of Left4Dead 2, I was looking for something in a similar play style where you have to really rely on your teammates. Although this misses out on any form of versus play, the cooperative mechanic is dead on. You are rewarded for precision hits against the AI, and at times that precision is required (I HATE BULLDOZERS). The goal oriented objectives puts a unique spin on cooperative play...but better yet are the options to stealth missions. Being able to stealthily acheive your goals without alerting police takes patience and practice, not to mention 3 other Player Characters that you can count on. Microphones are a must for stealth, and a real joy to play. The game is easy to learn but challenging to master, but well worth the time investment. Huge re-playability in this game.

content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
Gameplay: FantasticControls: GreatStability: GreatGraphics: Very GoodDifficulty: GoodSounds: GreatMusic: FantasticStory: N/APAYDAY: The Heist is a tactical First-Person shooter game where you play as a robber and comeplete various heist missions wither it's robbing a bank or stealing diamonds from a gallery whilest fending off of endless waves of cops, swat teams and FBI soldiers. The game features a large ranking system so it keeps you occupied to completing it for a very large amount of time.PROS/CONS+ Play offline with up to 3 bots+ Runs very smoothly+ Ranking system with 120 levels and 3 sepertate builds to unlock perks, weapons and upgrades+ 4 Special enemy types+ Challenges included to earn bonus XP and achievements+ Various masks to personalize yourself+ Various eqiupment, perks and weapons used for assisting teammates- Slightly poor stealth system that isn't used often- Achievements are a pain to unlockCONCLUSION:Very fun and satisfying to play, playing this with friends would be a blast.RECCORMENDED FOR THOSE WHO PLAY:Left 4 DeadNOTES:- There is a sequal to this game (PAYDAY 2)- This game features a DLC pack for more weapons, equipment, heists and upgrades.- This game has been out for quite a while, there may not be a lot of players online to play with.

content:
Posted: May 18, 2013
												HANDS UP! ON THE GROUND! PAYDAY: The Heist is one of the best co-op experiences I've had in my life. Even though it has a very limited amount of heists to perform, it has a great value of re-playability. Many of the primary events in each heist are randomized to make each game different.Regarding the engine, it is superb. Loads really fast, looks good, and feels great. It may have some bugs but considering this was all done by an indie company this is an outstanding job. The concept behind the game is simple, yet never seen before-- I can't believe they never made a game like this one. There are different heists, one at a bank, with a lot of shootout, other in a secret vault raid in the middle of the night, which has to be silent without setting off alarms, and so on. Each one is played in a different setting.It also has a great deal of collectibles; there are several masks which can be unlocked throughout the game by doing stuff like reaching a level, finishing a mission, completing a challenge, or finding an Easter egg or a secret.What's the best about this game? The Easter eggs and references to other elements in pop culture. The first mission is like the movie 'Heat', there are other elements which remind you of 'The Dark Knight'; but the most remarkable of them is the joint operation done by OVERKILL with VALVe to bring a mission set in Left 4 Dead's Mercy Hospital, which hints the beginning of the zombie outbreak.OVERKILL also designed many Alternate Reality Games inside the game. For instance, the PAYDAY Secret, also known as OVERDRILL, was one of the most important events in the game so far; and the rewarding feeling that many players had while unraveling the secret, is now paid by OVERKILL with a commemorative plaque inside the so called Overvault, with the names of the people who first discovered the secret.Overall, and even though the game is short and maybe not graphically perfect-- yet it looks very good--, this game is an excellent game and a must have. And if you get the Wolf Pack DLC it's even better, because it expands the game with two more missions and a whole new class to level up, as well as 48 new levels.Go and grab it on my mark... MARK!

content:
Posted: January 2, 2012
												This game is fun. Literally. I mean, I fully expected it to be a sucky game with a sucky plot and sucky characters and sucky graphics and a sucky script and sucky objectives and just be plain sucky. I have never been more wrong in my life. This game is not some mindless FPS bank-robbery GTA-based game. No. This game is brilliant. It's a shooter, it's a thinker, it's a stealth game. It's freakin' everything. You have $20? No? Hmm... Go rob a bank. It's a good prep for this game and the loot should give you the money you need. Now that you've got the $20, BUY THE GAME. Okay. Got $60? Buy this game for everyone and everyone you love! Hell, I'll take another copy! This game is win!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2012
												Maybe one of the best games I've bought this year. It would be a run-of-the-mill FPS were it not for two things: One, it's huge replay factor. The same heist played twice, while exactly the same AT FIRST, never turns out exactly like the first; you're always kept on your toes for the next surprise. The other thing that makes it unique is the skill tree, which can be changed in-game, during a heist, and does not need you to focus on a single class for you to have good enough perks and weapons for a successful heist.All in all a great game and, while not perfect in every single aspects, I'll say again it was perhaps one of my best purchases this year.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2012
												Killer Game, highley recommended - absolutely worth the purchase. Sooo much fun squadding up with mates/randoms and having a go at cracking the missions. However, (Bad Stuff), like many game releases these days, this title lacks further development in certain areas of gameplay which detract from it being a truly monumental FPS. Equally, there needs to be much more content(!!!)... This is one of those games that would be seemingly successful on Steam should the dev's release a multitude of DLC content.. On a final note, there are various bugs/updates/exploits that don't look like they're ever going to be ironed out, but it's essentially a must-have title IMO. Get it, come play.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2012
												Throw Left 4 Dead and the 1995 movie Heat and you got Payday : The Heist. This isn't really just L4D with cops. It's got it's own original gameplay than was L4D has. There's a level progression tree that can earn you weapons, equipment and upgrades. 5 memorable heists with a DLC on the way. And Endless replayability. It's just 5 heists but they are worth replaying over and over. Your skill gets better everytime you play. I recommand this game to anyone who likes co op games/ or a big L4D player. The community is small, only to have at least 400 active players but they are dedicated and the community should last for a while.8.5/10

content:
Posted: February 9, 2015
												It's one of the best cops and robbers game I've ever played.The storyline is alright but it's a bit short. Not so much plot or other things, just basic "you got a job to do, do it silently or go all in" The gameplay is great and not boring.Music is awesome! its not repetitive and fits the gameAI is alright for the AI Coop but the police AI is a bit idiotic at times.But the strongest point in this game goes to the Co- Op.you really need to co operate well with your teammate in order to achieve your goal. If your co operation failed the mission will fail! unless one of you is a hacker (FIX THIS)stealth cooperation is very hard to achieve and need good communication to do it prooperly, but the sesnse of achievemment is very rewarding. Although i have a tendencies to KILL THE CIVILIANS!!! xDoverall i give this game 7/10 a well done and must own

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Payday: The Heist is an amazingly fun game. I like how simple, independent games like these always manage to get me to sink many more hours into it than any of the higher budget titles that are out.Unlike most shooters out, Payday forces you to play realistically. Your goal is not to rack up a body count, but to perform a heist. When a Rambo tries to run into the open, and play the bad♥♥♥♥♥ they end up getting horribly♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ arrested, and then left behind as his teammates progress through the stage. The game just has a really intense feel as you yell at civilians to drop to the floor and shoot out surveillance cameras in preparation for police arrival.I have seen quite a few complaints about the AI being 'too sentry,' but imo, it is very realistic. The task force units feel professional and trained as I would expect any officer charging into a bank heist, or general hostage situation, would be. However, they are quite careless about shooting around civilians and you will often find yourself feeling like you are trying to save innocents from a reckless police riot. This game is made to be a Pure Teamwork Tactic and it's very important to make strategy and then excecute the plan, overall. Don't buy this game if you don't have friends to play with, sincerely you'll face having a hard time in heist. I recommend you should play in Co-op with your friends because of the needs to stick together, tactics and teamwork.Rated: 9.4/10

												Having bought this game during it's fantastic 90% off sale, This game is a tremendous amount of fun. Obviously no game is without it's flaws, which in PAYDAY consist of sometimes tedious gunplay and very very undetailed texture models on certain characters within the game. However, the co-op elements help the game move past these issues very well by utilising fun heists which must be pulled off with stealth and precision. All in all, If you're a fan of tactical, fast paced, co-op FPS's, then this game is a must have. 32/37 ChiggStars.

content:
Posted: January 28, 2016
												One of the better games that i've played.Pros:-No microtranscation [Check]-DLCs that are actually worth it [Check]-Over the top heists [Check]-Superb teamwork based games [Check]-Super low price [Check]-Superb soundtrack that never seems to grow old [Check]Cons:-Cannot respec trees without resetting levels-Way to little heists, even with the dlcs (Which adds 2)-Too little guns-Inability to customize weapons or at least downgrade them, if you do not like the sight given to you via the upgrade, too bad. Reminds me of saints row 3 and 4 upgrades which is a bad thing.-No way to go stealth, some heists give you the illusion of it but eventually you are gonna fight those dem cops.-Ai's have an IQ lower than 80. Play single player to observe the wondrous AI :DDespite listing more cons than pros, many of the cons are pretty minor and can be overlooked easily. Ultimately, payday the heist is a fun an addicting game especially when played with friends. In my opinion, this was the game that gave overkill a name of their own. The time where overkill actually cared for their fans, unlike the cashwhoring mentality they have now.Verdict:BUY THIS GAME!!! If you are tight on cash, buy it during a sale, its dirt cheap then.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2012
												Fast paced, team based (sp/a.i. or mp) game built around bank heists. Created by Overkill and published by SOE, this game released only to PC via Steam and Ps3 download. There are multiple objectives for each heist and the pressure stays on the whole mission, you can't cake walk through this one. If you like a fast-paced, first person, team based game that relies heavy on team work (rambos need not apply), then I suggest giving this game a try. The devs are in the Steam forums always getting community feedback and supporting their game and even recently added more free content -a new map/mission that they did with Valve (No Mercy- L4D level done the payday way ;) ). I love great games like these, (I've never had a bug)  that are released and not abandoned by the developer shortly after release. This one is still getting the love. Single player is fun and mp is still alive and well, no problems finding games.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2014
												PAYDAY:The Heist is a game where you and your crew that consists of 4 members Dallas, Hoxton, Chains, and Wolf go on mass robbing sprees to rob the many banks in Washington D.C. The game consists of robbing the First World Bank to robbing the Mercy Hospital for a total of 9 replayable missions. I enjoyed this game very much and recommend you to buy this along with the soundtrack to support Simon Viklund's great music and get the soundtrack masks. All in all I give this game a 9/10 it is a very fun game but gets better if you have 3 other friend to play with although playing with pubs is decent playing with friends make this 10 times better.

content:
Posted: October 17, 2015
												I really like this game from the start, but there are a few things I don't like and many people would care to disagree with these statements. I have heard that Payday 2 got some bad reviews after the "microtransactions" thing, but this game is better. First, we have the rank up system. It takes forever to rank up and get cool stuff; my friend bought me the DLC "wolf Pack" and I immediately thought I was going to already have the new weapons and equipment unlocked. that was not the case. Second, I would like to point out that the starting weapons are Peashooters and you can't get a kill with any of them (you get a crappy assault rifle and supressed pistol). Third, even on the lowest difficulty, you get killed too easily and that makes the game repetitive because you have to rely on other people (and AI) to help you up and you don't get your health back or anything else. Fourth, threre are a lot of glitches. On multiple occassions, I have seen enemies flying around like the have "noclip" on and enemies running through walls and barriers, which can be either frustrating or funny. Lastly, the game could do with a few more "heists" because the ones that are there now get repetitive because there is only about 7 of them and they consist of you: shooting cops and SWAT team members, dying, grabbing money (gold, Diamonds, etc.), tying up hostages, accidentally shooting Civilians because you thought they were cops, and objectives the require you to repetitively run back and fourth. I know this review sound negative, but I think this game is fun. I would like to see more work done with this game, even though Overkill probably won't add to or fix an old game, but it could have more "heists", more types of enemies, more weapons, a new (and better) rank up system, and possibly better (or different) starting weapons. Overall, I think it's fun to play with my Friends.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												PAYDAY: The Heist is a 4 player co-op FPS made by OVERKILL Software.In this game, you assume the role of one heister in doing multi-million dollar heists, including robbing a bank, to stealing a multitude of diamonds.The game has a limited span of weapons for use, and only has the AMCAR (M4/M16) and the b9-S (silenced pistol). The game has 145-193 (depending on the DLC you have) levels, all suited for full completion of the 4 skill trees. These specalize in Assault (damage), Support (Medical), Sharpshooter (Snipers, and accuracy) and Technician (Grenades, fixing stuff).The game has music made by Simon Viklund, and are unique to each heist.The heists, even if there are few, are very fun and unique. First World Bank - Robbing a bank Heat Street - Chasing a helper gone rogue through a city Green Bridge - Rescuing a Chinese Prisoner via blowing up a bridge. Diamond Heist - as the name entails, stealing diamonds, and one of the few stealth missions. Slaughterhouse - Chasing an armored van filled with gold into a slaughterhouse, where you drill it open and steal said gold. Counterfeit[DLC] - Going to Florida and stealing someones counterfeiting plates. Undercover[DLC] - Stealing an IRS server for the money. No Mercy - Stealing blood from a patient, L4D crossover.The game is, however, without flaws. The games graphics are eh, and use an outdated engine from 2001. The game is easy to hack and mod, however custom heists don't exist (and probably won't but a man can dream). Heists can also get repetitive, grinding up to 145/193. This game can get very VERY difficult when going into OVK 145+.I would reccomend this game, but get the game with friends to experience the game together. And if possible, buy the Wolf DLC.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 15, 2012
												Tight gunplay, decent graphics, so-bad-it's-good voiceovers, and killer music [by the always incredible Simon Viklund] make this game a standout. It's kind of like L4D without a versus mode; only teamwork is genuinely required here. If your team doesn't have it together, good luck trying to clear a heist even on Easy.With 145+ levels to upgrade and three different class branches to flesh out, six heists in-game [In locations like a bank, a gang hideout, and even major city streets in one heist],and more promised via cheap DLC; plus free events & difficulties being added via patches, this game is a gigantic steal for $20. If you're looking for a new zombie-free co-op game that will put your group of friends through the wringer, this is it.Friendly warning: Watch out for the Bulldozers. :P

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												Payday The Heist is yet another four-player-coop shooter.I in no way mean that as a bad thing.The introduction of Left 4 Dead near-single-handedly paved the way for a new genre of games, and Payday helps by continuing to lay down asphalt.Playing a heist alone is one of the most boring and grindy experiences one can find in modern games, but the moment you get a friend to join you, it is ridiculously fun.While I don't believe $9.99 is a perfect price tag, it's not a bad price tag. This game is easily worth two sandwiches, if not three.The upgrade system is unique and thus very fun to play with: every time you level up, you gain an upgrade in the skill tree you have selected, but at certain junctures you are forced to temporarily switch skill trees. As a result, you are forced to multiclass between Assault, Sharpshooter, and Support. Each class has its own three weapons, player upgrade, and tool.There is a fourth class, Technician, but it's a $9.99 DLC. The DLC costs as much as the game itself, and I am of the opinion that that is beyond ludicrously stupid.Play Payday if you can get a friend to join you.Average playtime: 25 hoursPrice: $9.99$/hour: $0.40Final Score: 8.5/10Letter Grade: BVerdict: "Easily worth two sandwiches."

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
												One of the sleeper hits of Steam, I really enjoy PAYDAY. Coming from over 2000hrs played of Left4Dead 2, I was looking for something in a similar play style where you have to really rely on your teammates. Although this misses out on any form of versus play, the cooperative mechanic is dead on. You are rewarded for precision hits against the AI, and at times that precision is required (I HATE BULLDOZERS). The goal oriented objectives puts a unique spin on cooperative play...but better yet are the options to stealth missions. Being able to stealthily acheive your goals without alerting police takes patience and practice, not to mention 3 other Player Characters that you can count on. Microphones are a must for stealth, and a real joy to play. The game is easy to learn but challenging to master, but well worth the time investment. Huge re-playability in this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 17, 2015
												I really like this game from the start, but there are a few things I don't like and many people would care to disagree with these statements. I have heard that Payday 2 got some bad reviews after the "microtransactions" thing, but this game is better. First, we have the rank up system. It takes forever to rank up and get cool stuff; my friend bought me the DLC "wolf Pack" and I immediately thought I was going to already have the new weapons and equipment unlocked. that was not the case. Second, I would like to point out that the starting weapons are Peashooters and you can't get a kill with any of them (you get a crappy assault rifle and supressed pistol). Third, even on the lowest difficulty, you get killed too easily and that makes the game repetitive because you have to rely on other people (and AI) to help you up and you don't get your health back or anything else. Fourth, threre are a lot of glitches. On multiple occassions, I have seen enemies flying around like the have "noclip" on and enemies running through walls and barriers, which can be either frustrating or funny. Lastly, the game could do with a few more "heists" because the ones that are there now get repetitive because there is only about 7 of them and they consist of you: shooting cops and SWAT team members, dying, grabbing money (gold, Diamonds, etc.), tying up hostages, accidentally shooting Civilians because you thought they were cops, and objectives the require you to repetitively run back and fourth. I know this review sound negative, but I think this game is fun. I would like to see more work done with this game, even though Overkill probably won't add to or fix an old game, but it could have more "heists", more types of enemies, more weapons, a new (and better) rank up system, and possibly better (or different) starting weapons. Overall, I think it's fun to play with my Friends.

content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
Gameplay: FantasticControls: GreatStability: GreatGraphics: Very GoodDifficulty: GoodSounds: GreatMusic: FantasticStory: N/APAYDAY: The Heist is a tactical First-Person shooter game where you play as a robber and comeplete various heist missions wither it's robbing a bank or stealing diamonds from a gallery whilest fending off of endless waves of cops, swat teams and FBI soldiers. The game features a large ranking system so it keeps you occupied to completing it for a very large amount of time.PROS/CONS+ Play offline with up to 3 bots+ Runs very smoothly+ Ranking system with 120 levels and 3 sepertate builds to unlock perks, weapons and upgrades+ 4 Special enemy types+ Challenges included to earn bonus XP and achievements+ Various masks to personalize yourself+ Various eqiupment, perks and weapons used for assisting teammates- Slightly poor stealth system that isn't used often- Achievements are a pain to unlockCONCLUSION:Very fun and satisfying to play, playing this with friends would be a blast.RECCORMENDED FOR THOSE WHO PLAY:Left 4 DeadNOTES:- There is a sequal to this game (PAYDAY 2)- This game features a DLC pack for more weapons, equipment, heists and upgrades.- This game has been out for quite a while, there may not be a lot of players online to play with.
